fields.name: Electronic Lock
fields.description: An electronic lock uses electrical current to control the bolt. It often requires a keypad, keycard, or biometric authentication for access.

fields.name: Combination Lock
fields.description: A combination lock requires a specific sequence of numbers or symbols to unlock. It is typically used in padlocks or safes.

fields.name: Keyed Lock
fields.description: A keyed lock requires a physical key to unlock. It is one of the most common types of locks.
